section.name: The Open Source Content Repository for Java
section.p: The Apache Jackrabbit project is an effort to build and maintain an open source implemention of the Content Repository for Java Technology API (JCR).
JCR 1.0 is specifed in Java Specification Request 170 (JSR-170). Work on JCR v2.0 has begun in JSR 283.

section.name: Releases
section.p: There are no releases available yet, but development is progressing quickly. To get Jackrabbit right now you can checkout and build your own instance. To see what still needs to be done before the first release, take a look at the Jira Road Map.

section.name: Documentation
section.p: For a basic overview and details on getting started, have a look at the Jackrabbit documention on this site.

Jackrabbit exposes most of its functionality to client applications thought that the JCR v1.0 API. If you want more detail on the API you can browse the Javadoc at http://www.day.com/maven/jsr170/javadocs/jcr-1.0
or download it as a zipped package at http://www.day.com/maven/jsr170/javadocs/jcr-1.0.javadoc

If you really want to know all the details, the best current documentation available is the JCR v1.0 specification itself, which you can get here: http://jcp.org/aboutJava/communityprocess/final/jsr170/index.html

In addition to implementing the JCR API, Jackrabbit has many extensions and admistrational features that are not (yet) specified by JCR. (see Architecture Overview). You can browse the internal Jackrabbit API here: http://incubator.apache.org/jackrabbit/apidocs/index.html
